page.title: 18HOUSES.
page.content: We started in the northern part of Messing and worked our way towards Easthorpe.Several people were not available to be interviewed.The people we did interview gave us the information we needed to complete our survey.The age of the houses in the Messing part of our D_Block ranges between thirteen and four hundred and ninety one years. Also all the houses in the Messing area are owned by the occupants.Not many people knew any history about their houses because most people were new tenants.One house in the Messing area had quite an interesting history.It used to be a building yard.They also had an old well in their back garden.When we reached Easthorpe there were only a few residents to be interviewed. One of the cottages was built within 100 years of the Norman conquest.
